Articles.Content:
Ok so it is letter from some name...

http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/V._Balakrishnan_%28physicist%29

who has worked in a number of fields of areas, including particle physics, many-body theory, the mechanical behavior of solids, dynamical systems, stochastic processes, and quantum dynamics. He is an accomplished researcher who has made important contributions to the theory of anelasticity, continuous-time random walks, and recurrences in dynamical systems.

My 1st guess ^ time warp to?

http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Vilhelm_Bjerknes

Norwegian physicist and meteorologist who did much to found the modern practice of weather forecasting.

self explanatory

http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Val_Logsdon_Fitch

is an American nuclear physicist

kaboom

http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Victor_Ambartsumian

He worked in the field of physics of stars and nebulae, stellar astronomy, dynamics of stellar systems and cosmogony of stars and galaxies, and contributed to mathematical physics.

interesting more stars in Kerbol system http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Star_system ?

http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Victor_Francis_Hess

who discovered cosmic rays

radiation?

http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Vikram_Sarabhai

He is considered the father of India's space programme.

moar capsules?

http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Victor_Weisskopf

During World War II he was Group Leader of the Theoretical Division of the Manhattan Project at Los Alamos,[2] and later campaigned against the proliferation of nuclear weapons.

KABOOM?

V from important name that fits Kerbal in context, funny, very funny.

Edited January 23, 2015 by Darnok
Famous engineer who worked on Project Orion?

Visigoths.

He is adding a tribe of Germanic barbarians who will raid and pillage ksc occasionally.

Confirmed: Kerbal Seafaring Program.
Vesuvius = Volcanoes

Clearly it's going to be something amazing and earthshattering, considering he's going to be excited to see how we react to it.

Hm, they said that about destroyable KSC and i was like "meh". ;P

Maybee because i never fly around there much.

Some V-Words:

vanguard: any creative group active in the innovation and application of new concepts and techniques in a given field

vast: unusually great in size or amount or degree or especially extent or scope

velocity: distance traveld per time

vendor: someone who promotes or exchanges goods or services for money

vivid: evoking lifelike images within the mind

voluminous: large in number or quantity

Sooo, could be anything and taunting us is just a hobby of Max as we know mh, as we are at this point, did Squad rush the release of .90 by one day opposing to the planed date? @MaxMaps

Greetings

Ben

P.S.: Maybee it's not the Letter V but V like in "Saturn V"

Edited January 23, 2015 by Navy2k

http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/James_Van_Allen

V for Van Allen

Double down: From Wikipedia:

"Van Allen led the scientific community for the inclusion of scientific research instruments on space satellites"

Edited January 23, 2015 by nukeboyt

Victoria Beckham. She has redesigned the flight suits and IVAs so they blend in nicely together.

Vijay Singh. A golf course on every planet?

Hey, what about Jules Verne?

Submersible functionality for mining on the bottom of Laythe/Eve oceans.

Its the letter V, V is also a symbol for five in the Roman alphabet, both Kevin and Bacon have 5 letters in them, Kevin has a v in it, so does voice, voice also has five letters. Five has a v in it also. Kevin bacon will be voice acting for Jebediah.
V for Vens Stock Part Revamp

VonoeL IexelA! Does V have to be the start or the end? Vostok? Vladimir? Valentina? Ven? Van? Von?!

Edited January 23, 2015 by Robotengineer

Every time i load up KSP, i think that ape is laughing at me.

So i think it simply means "next Version".
Maybe they are integrating Ven's Stock Part Revamp. Wouldn't surprise me in the slightest.

Every time i load up KSP, i think that ape is laughing at me.

So i think it simply means "next Version".

This is probably the most likely theory.
Vaquero! Kerbals will taking off their helmets on Kerbin EVA's, and putting on cowboy hats
Maxmaps kept the feature secret just for the enjoyment of seeing the forums try to guess what it actually was.

Ok. For adding more hilarious speculation ... V means V. A Indian Film director went by 'V' (Shantaram). And he is dead already. And Project 'V' is some kind of instant replay-fuctionality of your crashes test-flights as film, with some bollywoodesque music and dancing kerbals with the fireworks in the background.

I mean, how could it be something else?

This Project V clearly is:

not definite

not established

not determined

not confirmed

not known

I am uncertain of what it is.

Ok. For adding more hilarious speculation ... V means V. A Indian Film director went by 'V' (Shantaram). And he is dead already. And Project 'V' is some kind of instant......

Awesome! I can't give you any rep because of the IGC thread.
This thread is building hype steam.
For my on-the-record guess, I'm going with either "Valentina" for stock female Kerbals, or "Vesuvius" for particle-effect procedural volcanoes on Kerbin, Moho, and maybe one or more Joolian moons.
I'd put my money on either gerbals or van's texture replacer. I think it would be kinda cool if female kerbals were actually a different color, possibly maybe a pink or purple.

I'd put my money on either gerbals or van's texture replacer. I think it would be kinda cool if female kerbals were actually a different color, possibly maybe a pink or purple.

Hmmmm...

No.

I'd like to see non gender specific space suits. That move would add an element of sexism to ksp. Something I don't want.

A different coloured original three would be good, just not pink.

I'd like to see non gender specific space suits.

...I was referring to the color or their skin, but ok.

...I was referring to the color or their skin, but ok.
